title: Random walks on non-isomorphic Cayley graphs with same distribution
authors: Masao Ishikawa, Fumihiko Nakano and Taizo Sadahiro
abstract:
We construct an infinite family of triples (G,S1, S2) each consisting of a
group G and a pair (S1, S2) of distinct subsets of G with the following
properties. i The two Cayley graphs Cay(G, S1) and Cay(G,S2) are
non-isomorphic. ii The distributions of the simple random walks on Cay(G,S1)
and Cay(G,S2) are the same if one takes an appropriate correspondence between
the two vertex sets at each step. iii The spectral set of Cay(G, Si) is
decomposed into a disjoint union of two subsets A and B_i of the equal size
which satisfies B1 = -B2.
